text: Snow drifts across the bodies of the fallen dead. Eight corpses lie frozen on the ground-- men, women, and childr wearing heavy furs. The wind whips through their long hai At the edge of the clearing, WILL (20), a young ranger dressed all in black, surveys the grim scene from the bac his gelding. He gathers his reins and guides his horse so

Will rides hard between the towering pines, his horse’s hooves kicking up fresh-fallen snow. He comes to a halt and dismounts beside two tethered hors His comrades, GARED (50) and SER WAYMAR ROYCE (18), crouc beside a stream, filling their skins with cold water. The rise and look to the newcomer expectantly. Ser Waymar is gray-eyed and graceful, with an aristocrat’ air of command despite his youth. He wears a supple coat gleaming black ringmail and a lush sable cloak. Will and Gared also wear the black of the Night’s Watch, their clothes are far less regal, their leather and fur battered from hard usage. Gared wears a hood for warmth.
We should start back. They’re all dead. Gared offers Will his water skin and Will takes a drink.
Any blood?
Not that I saw.
How close did you get?
Close enough to see they was dead.
(skeptical) Or sleeping?
If Will says they’re dead, they’re dead. We should head back to the Wall. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
(with the hint of a smile) Do the dead frighten you?
Mormont said we should track ‘em. We tracked ‘em. They won’t trouble us no more.
You don’t think Mormont will ask us how they died? He walks toward his horse. Gared and Will exchange a trou glance.

Moonlight shines down on the clearing, the ashes of the firepit, the snow-covered lean-to. If there were corpses the ground before, they’re gone now. The three riders enter the camp. Their horses seem spooke as if they smell a predator nearby.
Your dead men seem to have moved camp. Will looks around, confused. He knows what he saw.

They were here... Spotting something shimmering on the ground near the fire he walks his horse closer, dismounts and looks down. Lying at his feet is the hilt of a steel longsword. The b has been shattered into a thousand shards. Will stares at the shattered sword. He knows what this me the dread on his face is unmistakable. From his horse, Gared looks at the ground. The indentatio where the bodies once lay are still visible-- as are the faint but unmistakable footprints leading away from them.

We have to move. Now. He is interrupted by a neigh. Will’s horse, riderless and panicked, bolts from the camp site. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca Ser Waymar’s horse rears back on its hind legs, throwing rider to the ground before galloping after the first hors Gared struggles to keep his own horse under control. Ser Waymar stands unsteadily, brushing the snow from his cloa

(terrified) Gods... He’s staring into the darkness at the edge of the clearin Ser Waymar turns to see what the young tracker sees: a sh emerging from the forest. A figure steps into the moonlight, tall and gaunt, with f pale as milk. It slides toward the rangers on silent feet Its armor appears to be carved from ice. Its sword is translucent, a shard of crystal so thin it almost seems t vanish when seen edge-on. Ser Waymar’s voice cracks like a boy’s:

Stay where you are! The OTHER keeps coming. Ser Waymar draws his sword with trembling hands. Will, standing near the fire pit, and Ga still on horseback, draw their own swords. The Other halts. For the first time we see its eyes, blue than any human eyes, a blue that burns like ice. They emerge silently from the shadows, on all sides of th clearing. Five of them... six... seven... their strange swords shimmering in the moonlight. Gared can no longer control his panicked horse; it bolts the clearing, ignoring its rider’s commands. The Others watch Gared flee. They turn back to Ser Waymar Will and begin to advance on the young men. As the circle closes, the Others speak to each other in a language we’ve never heard, with voices like cracking ice Waymar and Will stand together, class distinctions forgot two boys about to die. They steady their sword hands and mutter quick prayers as the Others descend upon them.

Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca CLOSE on a pair of ancient, gnarled hands writing a mess on a small parchment scroll. The old man (we never see hi face) tightly rolls the scroll, binds it with a black rib and ties it with a leather strip to the leg of a BLACK RA The old man lifts the raven off his desk; it flaps its da wings and flies out of the open chamber window. The raven flies away from Castle Black, a large and ancie fortress dwarfed by what lies behind it: the Wall. Older history, this is the 800-foot-high barrier of ice and sto that guards the northern edge of the Seven Kingdoms. As the raven gains altitude, the landscape below it TRANSFORMS into a map of Westeros. The Wall is revealed t cross the entire continent, a boundary between the Haunte Forest to the north and the civilized lands to the south. The raven flies south over the map, on which the cities, regions and features of the land are named: Winterfell, t Kingsroad, Moat Cailin, the Riverlands, the Vale of Arryn Occasionally the bird dips down, and the map resolves bac into reality for just long enough to give us a view of so points of interest: Winterfell’s old stone towers, full o cold beauty. The foreboding Eyrie castle high atop the Va of Arryn, a feat of montane architecture that would have impossible for medieval engineers. When the raven reaches King’s Landing, the map resolves b into reality as the bird drops down into the dirty sprawl the capital. The raven flies through the open gates of the Red Keep, a massive compound with red walls the color of blood. The b flies through an open window into the throne room, to lan the Iron Throne itself-- a throne built from the hammered swords of a thousand defeated enemies. The raven pecks at its wings, cleaning itself after the l journey, alone in the empty throne room.

LORD EDDARD “NED” STARK (40) sits on his motionless horse his long brown hair stirring in the wind. His closely-tri beard is shot with white. He has spent half his life trai for war and the other half waging it, and his face convey both authority and a haunted sadness. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca He is accompanied by a dozen members of the HOUSEHOLD GU all on horseback. Over their heads flaps the Stark banner gray direwolf racing across an ice-white field. South of the Wall the grass is still green and the sun is shining, but the air is cold enough to cloud the breath o four guardsmen as they escort Gared toward the stump of a massive oak tree. Weeks have passed since we saw the ranger but he seems to have aged years, his eyes bloodshot and weary, his face haggard, his clothes filthy and torn. Ned’s sons, JON SNOW (17), ROBB STARK (17) and BRAN STARK sit on their own horses (a small pony in Bran’s case). Jon is slender, darker than his half-brothers, his eyes b and watchful. Robb is big and broad, with fair skin and reddish-brown h Bran sits very still, watching the doomed man. He has nev seen an execution before. The prospect of it terrifies hi but he tries hard to imitate his father’s solemn expressi The Guardsmen force Gared’s head onto the stump. Ned dismounts. His ward, THEON GREYJOY (19), hands over Ned’s sword: Ice beautiful weapon, centuries old. Theon is the only man in party wearing a kraken sigil instead of a dire wolf. Ned peels off his gloves and hands them to JORY CASSEL (3 a bull-necked warrior with a heavy mustache. Ned walks to the stump. He speaks in low tones to Gared, responds. We watch this exchange from the boys’ perspecti Gared’s final words clearly trouble Ned, who studies the condemned man’s face, judging his honesty. Bran watches from afar, his head slightly cocked, trying make out what Gared is saying. There is a great weariness in Ned’s eyes as he places bot hands on the hilt of his greatsword.

In the name of Robert of the House Baratheon, the First of his Name-- As Ned delivers the formal sentence to the condemned man, Snow moves closer to Bran. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

(whisper) King of the Andals and the Keep the pony in hand. And First Men, Lord of the Seven don’t look away. Father will Kingdoms and Protector of th know if you do. Realm-- Bran keeps his pony well in hand and does not look away.

I, Eddard of the House Stark, Lord of Winterfell and Warden of the North, sentence you to die. Ned lifts Ice high above his head and brings it down. Blood sprays the swaying grass. Gared’s head topples off the stump, bounces off a root, a rolls. When Ned’s back is turned, Theon put his boot on t head, kicks it away and laughs. Jon watches this with disgust but says nothing. He turns grips Bran’s shoulder.
You did well. It’s only three words, but compliments are hard to come b the Stark house. Bran is proud to be treated like a man, he cannot look away from the head lying in the tall grass
Bran rides with his brothers, his hard-working pony tryin keep up with the bigger horses.
I thought he was brave.
Brave? He was dead of fear. You could see it in his eyes.
What would be in your eyes with your head on the stump? He died well. Give him that much. Robb considers the point for a moment and shrugs, already losing interest in the subject.

Race you to the bridge? Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca Jon rolls his eyes as if he’s beyond such juvenile games then, without warning, he spurs his horse and gains a goo head start. Robb curses and follows. They gallop off down trail, Robb laughing and hooting, Jon silent. Bran’s pony can’t compete in that race, so he follows slo behind, craning his neck to see if he can spot the winner
You understand why I did it? Bran turns in his saddle, startled. On his great warhorse Ned looms above him like a giant. Bran nods to his father

Jon said he was a deserter. He was in the Night’s Watch and he ran away. Even when speaking with his son, Ned constantly surveys h surroundings, aware of his men’s positions, the possible sites for an ambush, the angle of the sun.
True enough, but do you understand why I had to kill him? Bran thinks about this for a few seconds, confused.
King Robert has a headsman.
He does. As did the Targaryen kings before him. Ned reaches out to grab the pommel on Bran’s saddle. He forces the horse and pony to walk very close.
Our way is the old way. The man who passes the sentence should swing the sword. Bran stares at the massive sword sheathed at Ned’s hip.
Is it true he saw the Others? Ned stares at his son for a long beat. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
You heard that? (off Bran’s nod) The Others have been gone for eight thousand years.
So he was lying?
He believed it. A madman sees what he sees. They’re interrupted by the sound of hooves; Jon reappears the crest of the hill before them, waving urgently.
Over here!

Ned’s party reaches the riverbank. Jon has dismounted bes Robb, who cradles something in his arm. Bran and Ned stay back with the rest of their party as Jo and Theon approach the older boys. When he sees what lies on the ground beside Robb, Theon curses and pulls his horse away. Jory does the same and y to the boys:
Get away from it!
She can’t hurt you. She’s dead. Burning with curiosity, Bran spurs his pony to keep up wi Ned as they approach the others, who are all dismounting.
What in hell is it? Bran finally gets close enough to see.
A wolf. The dead wolf is impossibly huge, bigger than Bran’s pony Its blind eyes crawl with maggots.
It’s a freak. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
No. That’s a direwolf. Ned kneels beside the wolf. Groping under the beast’s hea he gives a yank and comes up with a foot of shattered ant slick with half-dried blood.
There hasn't been a direwolf south of the Wall for two hundred years. Jon looks at the bundle beneath Robb’s arm and grins:

Well... now there are five. When Bran sees what everyone is staring at his eyes widen moves in to get a closer look at the direwolf pup-- a tin ball of gray-black fur, eyes still closed, nuzzling blind against Robb’s chest, whimpering.
Tough old beast, wasn’t she? Birthing a litter with an antler in her throat.
(to Bran) Go on. You can touch him. Bran gives the pup a quick, nervous stroke. As he turns:

Here you go. Jon thrusts another pup into Bran’s arms. Overjoyed, Bran plops down in the snow and rubs the wolf pup’s soft fur against his cheek. Ned picks up two more helpless pups, one in each hand. Jo picks up the fifth. HULLEN (40s), the horse master, frowns at this ill omen.
Direwolves loose in the realm.
Not for long. Theon draws his sword and reaches for Bran’s pup. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  10.
Give it here.
No! It’s mine! Robb speaks to Theon in a commanding tone.
Put your sword away. We’re keeping them. Theon bristles at the command.
I take orders from your father, not you.
It’'ll be a mercy to kill them.
No! Bran looks to Ned for support, but finds none.
Better a quick death. They won’t last without their mother.

Lord Stark... There are five pups. Three male, two female. (off Ned’s curiosity) You have five trueborn children. Three sons, two daughters. The direwolf is the sigil of your House. Everyone looks to the Stark banners, with their direwolf crest-of-arms. We see their opinions about the pups chang as they come to understand the import of this omen.
Your children were meant to have these pups.
And you?
I am not a Stark, my Lord. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  11. Ned weighs the situation for a moment in silence.
You will feed them yourselves. And train them yourselves. Bran nods eagerly. Robb nods as well.
They may die anyway, despite all you do.

They won’t. We won’t let them. The decision made, people start to remount their horses. Bran tugs gratefully on Jon’s sleeve. Jon smiles at him, beneath his smile there is a trace of sadness. Jon is about to climb onto his horse when he hears a dist whimpering. Leaving the horse behind, he ranges into a sn drift, and scans the ground until he finds the source: A sixth wolf pup, with white fur. Unlike the others, its are blood-red and open, and it is completely silent. Jon picks it up. Theon scoffs.
An albino. It’1l die even faster than the others. Jon ignores Theon. He stares into the pup’s eyes and the stares back.
This one belongs to me.

DAENERYS (15) stands by the window, staring out at the ba Pentos, where shirtless FISHERMEN haul nets full of wrigg fish from their boats onto the docks. The setting sun silhouettes the brick towers of the Free City; intricate colorful geometric patterns decorate their bulbous domes. Daenerys is a beautiful girl but nobody has bothered to t her. She is awkward in her own skin, unaware of how rare violet eyes and lush silver hair really are. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  12.
Where’s my sweet sister? VISERYS (20) steps into the room, a gaunt young man with nervous hands and a feverish look in his pale eyes. He ho a lilac gown in his hands.
A gift from Illyrio. Touch it. Go on. Feel the fabric. Dany lets the delicate silk run through her fingers. It i gorgeous gown but the sight of it gives her no pleasure.
Tonight you must look like a princess. Daenerys hands the gown back to her brother.
He gives us so much... we’ve been his guests for a year and he’s never asked for anything.
Illyrio’s no fool. He knows I won't forget my friends when I come into my throne. He hangs the gown from a hook beside the door.
I’ll send the slaves in to bathe you. Be sure you wash off that stable stink. He studies her critically.
You still slouch. He pushes back her shoulders.

Let them see you have a woman’s body now. His fingers brush lightly over her breasts, judging their shape beneath the rough fabric of her tunic. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  13.
Don’t fail me tonight. You don’t want to wake the dragon, do you? His fingers tighten over one of her nipples, pinching. He hurting her but Daenerys does not resist or open her mout
Do you?
No.
Good. He smiles, releasing her, brushing back her hair with something like affection.
When they write the history of my reign, they will say it began tonight.
A dozen STRONG MEN carry a palanquin through the pitch-bl streets of Pentos. Two SERVANTS walk in front, holding oi lanterns to light the way.

Inside the curtained litter, Daenerys, Viserys and MAGIST ILLYRIO recline on soft pillows. Daenerys wears the lilac gown. Her makeup has been artfully applied but somehow sh looks even younger than before. She seems terribly nervou Illyrio (50) is tremendously fat, but he carries himself a certain elegance. He smiles at Daenerys, takes the girl hand and gives her a comforting squeeze.
(to Viserys) She is a vision, your Grace. Drogo will be impressed.
She’s too skinny. Are you sure he likes his women this young?
She’s had her blood, she’s old enough. Look at her! (MORE )
Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  14. ILLYRIO (cont'd) Highest of the highborn, daughter of the past king, sister to the future king... he’1ll want her.
I suppose. The savages have queer tastes. Boys, horses, sheep...
Best not suggest this to Khal Drogo.
Do you take me for a fool? Magister Illyrio gives a slight bow.

I take you for a king. Kings lack the caution of common men. My apologies if I have given offense. He claps his hands and a SLAVE BOY wearing a brass collar crouched in the corner of the litter, hurries over to ref Illyrio’s wine glass.
I know how to play a man like Drogo. I give him status-- (modding at Dany) -- and he gives me an army. His fingers toy with the hilt of his sheathed sword.
I could sweep the Seven Kingdoms with ten thousand Dothraki screamers behind me. The people will be with us. They cry out for their true king. Viserys pauses and gives Illyrio an anxious look.
They do, don’t they?

(an amiable salesman) All across the Kingdoms, men lift secret toasts to your health. Their women sew dragon banners in hope of your return from across the water. (shrugs ) Or so my agents tell me. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  15. Daenerys, who has watched Illyrio throughout his speech, turns away. She keeps her own counsel, but it’s clear the words that so inspire Viserys do not impress her.

A great field outside the city walls of Pentos, ringed by hundreds of the distinctive, round Dothraki tents. The moon and burning torches light the milling guests. Ma are DOTHRAKI HORSELORDS, big men, their black hair oiled braided and hung with silver bells. No women are present. A smooth-cheeked EUNUCH announces the newcomers:

Viserys of the House Targaryen, the Third of his Name. King of the Andals and the First Men, Lord of the Seven Kingdoms and Protector of the Realm. His sister Daenerys Stormborn, Princess of Dragonstone. His honorable host, Illyrio Mopatis, Magister of the Free City of Pentos. The three honored guests step into the clearing. Illyrio guides them, pointing out various luminaries.
Those three are Drogo’s bloodriders. The BLOODRIDERS, fearsome Dothraki warriors, stare back a Daenerys. She quickly averts her eyes.
Over there is Ser Jorah Mormont.

A knight? What’s he doing here? SER JORAH is past forty and balding, but still strong and fit. When he sees the Targaryens staring at him he bows deeply. Viserys gives a slight nod, pleased by the obeisa
King Robert- (correcting himself) -the Usurper wanted his head. Some trifling affront. Sold poachers to a slaver. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  16.
He could be useful. Illyrio places his hand on Daenerys’ bare shoulder.

Over there, sweet princess. There is the Khal himself. KHAL DROGO (30) is the tallest man in the courtyard, but despite his size and musculature, he has the grace of a panther. His black hair is woven into a single braid, hun with silver bells, that swings below his belt. Illyrio walks over to the Khal (a dozen yards away). Vise leans closer to his sister, never taking his eyes off Dro

You see how long his hair is? When Dothraki are defeated in combat, they cut off their braids in disgrace, so the world will know their shame. Khal Drogo has never been defeated. A savage, of course, but one of the finest killers alive. And you will be his queen. Daenerys stares at the Khal. The man’s face is hard and cruel, his eyes dark as onyx as he watches Illyrio perfor his submissions.

(her voice small and thin) I don’t want to be his queen. Please, please, I don’t want to, I want to go home. Viserys maintains a mask of politeness and keeps his voic low, but there is fury behind his eyes.
Home? How do we go home? They took it from us. He grabs her arm and drags her into the shadows, his fingernails digging into her.
How do we go home? Tears well in her eyes. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  17.
I don’t know.
I do. We go home with an army. With Khal Drogo’s army. He brushes her cheek with the back of his hand and speaks her with real tenderness.

I’d let his whole khalasar fuck you, all forty thousand men and their horses too, if that’s what it took. Come, dry your eyes. Dany wipes away the unfallen tears. Illyrio, all smiles a bows, escorts Khal Drogo toward them.

(nervous whisper) Smile. And stand up straight. Let him see that you have breasts. Gods know, they’re small enough as is. Dany smiles and stands up straight. EXT. KING’S LANDING - DAY The walled city of King’s Landing, capital of Westeros. T royal castle, the Red Keep, built of red sandstone, perch on the cliffs above Blackwater Bay. The seven-towered Gre Sept of Baelor rises on the south edge of the city. In between sprawls the fetid slum called Flea Bottom. We PULL IN closer to the Red Keep, to a window near the t of the Tower of the Hand.

JON ARRYN (60s), cold and still, lies on his deathbed. Two SILENT SISTERS, veiled adherents to the Faith of the Seven, fold his hands across his chest and close his eyel GRAND MAESTER PYCELLE (70s) stands beside them. He wears heavy chain around his neck, each link forged with a different metal. Beside him is QUEEN CERSEI (30s). Green-eyed and golden- haired, the queen’s beauty has already become legend. Bot look down at Jon Arryn. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  18.
I gave him milk of the poppy at the end. To ease his path. Cersei touches the old Maester’s arm in thanks.
We are blessed to have a man of your wisdom caring for us. The old Maester is not too old to appreciate a little flattery, or the touch of a beautiful woman.
He was peaceful, in his final hours?
Mostly he slept, my Grace. Though he had moments of clarity.
Did he? What did he say, in these moments of clarity?
He asked to see the King--
Robert will never forgive himself for not being here. These hunts of his last longer and longer.
And he asked to see Lord Stark.
A shame Lord Stark is a thousand leagues away. That was all?
Yes... No. There was a phrase, one phrase he kept repeating. “The seed is strong.” Cersei focuses her green eyes on the Maester.
The seed is strong? What does that mean? Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  19.
(shrugs ) The dying mind is a demented mind. For all the weight they’re given, last words usually have as much significance as first words.
Where is the Hand’s wife?
Lady Arryn left the moment he breathed his last. Cersei turns and heads for the door.
Send a raven to Casterly Rock. My father should know Jon Arryn is dead.
At once, my Grace. Cersei exits the bedchamber. Pycelle watches the Sisters perform their ritual ablutions, imagining, perhaps, the n too-distant day when they will minister to his own corpse
The most dangerous neighborhood in the kingdom. DRUNKS sp out of doorways of taverns lit with oil lamps, singing:
She kicked and wailed, the maid so fair, but he licked the honey from her hair, her hair! Her hair!

Outside we hear the sounds of rough laughter and singing. room is expensively appointed in silks, damasks and gilde ornaments, but its garishness betrays its true nature. That, and the naked REDHEADED WHORE on her knees beside t bed. She bestows oral favors upon TYRION LANNISTER, a dwa with mismatched eyes: one green, one black. Tyrion’s hands grip her hair as he shudders. Bells begin ring outside, thousands of them, great pealing bells from across the city. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  20. The Redhead, finished with her work, wipes her mouth with back of her hand.
Who they ringing the bells for?
The King’s Hand died this morning. Tyrion grabs a goblet of wine from the bedside table. He swigs and passes it to the whore. She raises it in toast.
Here’s to Jon Arryn, then. He was the only one of you lot who cared about the smallfolk. She drinks deeply, sloshing the wine around her mouth.
I care about the smallfolk.
Only the ones with good tits. Who's Robert picking for a new Hand?
If he’s smart, my father.
And if he’s not smart?
If the King is not smart? Milady, these are treasonous words... He clamps his palms on the back of her head and guides he back toward his crotch. The Redhead laughs, disbelieving.
No chance you're ready again. He takes the goblet from her, downs the remainder, and to it across the room.

The gods gave me one blessing. The Redhead grins and pushes her hair away from her face she dips down for further service. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  21. Just as Tyrion closes his eyes the door swings open. SER JAIME LANNISTER (30s), the Queen’s twin brother, stands i the doorway. Considered by many the best-looking man in the Seven Kingdoms, there is a hint of savagery behind his green ey He smiles as the Redhead, flustered, covers her breasts.
Don’t get up.
Forgive me, my lord...
Should I explain to you, dear brother, the meaning of a closed door in a whorehouse? Jaime continues to favor the redhead with his lazy grin, fucking her with his eyes as he speaks with his brother.
You have much to teach me, no doubt, but in this instance perhaps you'll forgive the interruption. You told me once that you wanted to see the North. I didn’t want you to miss your chance.
Who’s going North?
We are. The royal “we.” The King. The Queen. Me. You, if you can find your pants.
Why?
Well, I’m used to it, but the rest of the court might be frightened by the sight of your wet little dagger.
(annoyed) Why are we going north? Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  22.
The King has chosen his Hand. And no one’s going to be happy about it.

Winterfell, the stronghold and ancestral home of House St is an ancient and austere place. Many acres lie within it two concentric granite walls; its keeps and towers stretc toward the gray skies above. A RAVEN flies into view, heading toward the stronghold wi small parchment scroll dangling from its leg. We follow the black bird as it glides over the Winterfell walls, banks over the main courtyard, and comes to rest o the windowsill of INT. MAESTER LUWIN’S CHAMBER - CONTINUOUS The raven jumps from its windowsill perch onto the arm of MAESTER LUWIN (75). He is a small, gray man: gray eyes, g hair, gray wool robe. A heavy chain lies around his neck, much like Maester Pycelle’s. The Maester removes the scroll from the raven’s leg and o it. His face darkens as he reads.

A thousand years of humus lie thick upon the forest floor swallowing the sound of a woman’s feet as she walks. LADY CATELYN STARK (35), Ned’s auburn-haired, blue-eyed w makes her way among the dark tree trunks, their twisted branches weaving a dense canopy over her head. In her han she holds the small parchment scroll from the above scene She reaches a small grove at the center of the wood, wher ancient weirwood tree broods over a small, black pool. Looking like no tree on Earth, the weirwood’s bark is bon white, its leaves dark red. Long, long ago, a melancholy was carved into its trunk; its deep-cut eyes are red with dried sap. They seem to follow her as she rounds the tree Seated on a moss-covered stone on the other side of the t Ned rests his sword, Ice, across his knees as he cleans i with a cloth dipped in the black waters at his feet.

I knew I'd find you here. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  23. He lifts his head to look at her. He sees her shivering a hands her his cloak, which she wraps around herself befor sitting on the forest floor. He registers her somber face, and the scroll in her hand. stops cleaning his sword.
Tell me.
Forgive me, my lord... there was a raven from King’s Landing. Jon Arryn is dead. Ned looks at the wet sword, lying flat across his lap.
How?
A fever took him. He was healthy at the full moon and gone by the half.
Your sister, the boy...?
The letter said they’re well. Ned looks more angry than grief-stricken. He dries his sw with a swatch of oiled leather.
He loved you very much.
I haven’t seen him in how long, nine years?
You couldn't have known--

Of course I could have known. He was an old man. Every year he asked me to visit and every year I told him, “Next year.” He sheathes the blade. Catelyn reaches for his hand. For moment they are silent. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  24.
The girls won’t remember him. Bran never even met him.
You’11 tell them the stories.
Old Jon would have been proud of Bran. He was a brave boy at the beheading. Catelyn is troubled by the thought. She releases his hand
Eight is too young to see such things.
Should I tell you about the things I saw before I was eight? (beat) He won’t be a child forever. And winter is coming. The words disturb Catelyn but she keeps her silence.
His brothers helped him. Especially Jon.

Jon Snow is his half-brother. My lord. Ned notes his wife’s tone but says nothing. This isn’t a fight he needs right now. Catelyn, realizing she has broa the wrong topic at the wrong time, changes the subject.

The raven brought more news. The king rides for Winterfell. (beat) Along with the queen and her brothers. Ned considers this prospect for a moment. Clearly Catelyn already has. They both know what it means.
He hates the cold. Always has. If he comes this far north, it’s one thing he’s after. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  25.
You can always say No. Ned allows a grim smile, taking his wife’s hand and helpi her to her feet.
You don’t know the king very well.
